docs.lead_paragraph: The salaries paid to city workers have gotten much scrutiny in recent days. First, the Manhattan Institute's Empire Center for New York State Policy placed on its SeeThroughNY Web site an online, searchable database of all city employees' salaries.

headline.main: Cost of City Workers' Pensions Has Soared

docs.abstract: The average compensation cost of full-time employees of the city, when including both pay and fringe benefits, is $106,743, a result of the skyrocketing costs of pensions and health insurance.
docs.snippet: The average compensation cost of full-time employees of the city, when including both pay and fringe benefits, is $106,743, a result of the skyrocketing costs of pensions and health insurance.

docs.lead_paragraph: Wrap Up Mr. Daschle's appearance today before the Health, Education, Labor and Pensions Committee was by no means his last. While the HELP committee heard his views on various health issues, its members do not vote in committee on Mr. Daschle's confirmation. Next week, he is expected to appear before the Finance Committee, which does take a formal vote.

headline.main: Live Blog: Daschle Returns to the Senate

docs.abstract: Former Majority Leader Tom Daschle returns to his former haunts for his confirmation hearing.
docs.snippet: Former Majority Leader Tom Daschle returns to his former haunts for his confirmation hearing.

docs.lead_paragraph: The following is a transcript of President-Elect Barack Obama’s speech on the economy, as prepared by Federal News Service.

docs.lead_paragraph: In a speech that he will deliver this morning at George Mason University in Virginia, President-elect Barack Obama plans to warn Americans that without bold action on the economy, "a bad situation could become dramatically worse."

headline.main: The Early Word: Obama Defends Economic Plan

docs.abstract: In a speech he will deliver later today President-elect Barack Obama will warn of dire consequences if no action is taken on the economic stimulus package he and Democratic leaders are proposing.
docs.snippet: In a speech he will deliver later today President-elect Barack Obama will warn of dire consequences if no action is taken on the economic stimulus package he and Democratic leaders are proposing.

docs.lead_paragraph: Hardly anyone has a good word to say about this country's fragmented system for delivering and paying for long-term care, with one exception: the PACE program, which many experts laud as long-term care done right.

headline.main: Health Care Delivered as It Should Be

docs.abstract: One model for long-term care is earning much-deserved praise.
docs.snippet: One model for long-term care is earning much-deserved praise.

docs.lead_paragraph: At a confirmation hearing Thursday, Tom Daschle will most likely be asked about Barack Obama’s call for a new public health insurance plan.

docs.lead_paragraph: Buried within new statistics was sobering evidence that growing health costs can only be remedied through deep-seated reform.

docs.lead_paragraph: The elderly are less likely to receive follow-up care for mental illness when their out-of-pocket costs are higher than for other medical care.
